GenAIRR.utilities package

Submodules

GenAIRR.utilities.AlleleNComparer module

class GenAIRR.utilities.AlleleNComparer.AlleleNComparer[source]

Bases: object

A class to compare alleles and find indistinguishable alleles based on specific positions.

This class allows for the addition of alleles with their sequences, comparison of alleles to identify indistinguishable ones based on specified positions, and saving/loading of allele data.

alleles

A dictionary storing the sequences of each allele, with allele IDs as keys and sequences as values.

Type:

dict

add_allele(allele_id, sequence)[source]

Adds an allele and its sequence to the alleles dictionary.

Parameters:

  • allele_id (str) -- The unique identifier for the allele.

  • sequence (str) -- The nucleotide sequence of the allele.

find_indistinguishable_alleles(allele_id, n_positions)[source]

Finds alleles that are indistinguishable from a specified allele, ignoring specified positions.

Parameters:

  • allele_id (str) -- The ID of the target allele to compare against.

  • n_positions (list or set) -- Positions to be ignored during the comparison.

Returns:

A set of allele IDs that are indistinguishable from the specified allele, excluding the specified positions. str: An error message if the specified allele ID is not found in the alleles dictionary.

Return type:

set

load(filename)[source]

Loads an alleles dictionary from a file using pickle for deserialization.

Parameters:

filename (str) -- The name of the file from which the alleles dictionary will be loaded.

Updates:

The method updates the alleles dictionary with the contents loaded from the file.

save(filename)[source]

Saves the alleles dictionary to a file using pickle for serialization.

Parameters:

filename (str) -- The name of the file where the alleles dictionary will be saved.

GenAIRR.utilities.asc_utilities module

GenAIRR.utilities.asc_utilities.allele_diff(reference_allele, sample_allele, position_threshold=0, snps=True)[source]

Identifies differences between two alleles, optionally considering only positions beyond a threshold and reporting single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs).

Parameters:

  • reference_allele (str) -- The sequence of the reference allele.

  • sample_allele (str) -- The sequence of the sample allele to compare against the reference.

  • position_threshold (int, optional) -- The position from which to start comparing the sequences. Defaults to 0, which means comparison starts from the beginning.

  • snps (bool, optional) -- If True, differences are reported as SNPs in the format 'RefPositionSample'. If False, only the positions of differences are reported. Defaults to True.

Returns:

A list of SNPs or position indices where the two alleles differ, considering the specified threshold and SNP reporting preference.

Return type:

list

GenAIRR.utilities.asc_utilities.asc_clust(germline_distance, germline_set, family_threshold=75, allele_cluster_threshold=95, trim_3prime_side=318)[source]

Performs hierarchical clustering on alleles based on their Hamming distances and classifies them into families and allele clusters.

Parameters:

  • germline_distance (ndarray) -- A square matrix of pairwise Hamming distances between alleles.

  • germline_set (dict) -- A dictionary of allele sequences with allele names as keys.

  • family_threshold (int, optional) -- The distance threshold for classifying alleles into families. Defaults to 75.

  • allele_cluster_threshold (int, optional) -- The distance threshold for classifying alleles within families into clusters. Defaults to 95.

  • trim_3prime_side (int, optional) -- The position up to which sequences should be considered for clustering. Defaults to 318.

Returns:

A pandas DataFrame with columns for family and allele cluster assignments, allele names, and additional columns for duplicated alleles and differences past the trim position.

Return type:

DataFrame

GenAIRR.utilities.asc_utilities.asc_dict(allele_cluster_table, germline_set)[source]

Converts an allele cluster table into a dictionary of VAllele objects organized by allele cluster sequence (ASC).

Parameters:

  • allele_cluster_table (DataFrame) -- A pandas DataFrame containing allele family and cluster assignments.

  • germline_set (dict) -- A dictionary of original allele sequences with allele names as keys.

Returns:

A dictionary where keys are ASC identifiers and values are lists of VAllele objects belonging to each ASC.

Return type:

defaultdict

GenAIRR.utilities.asc_utilities.asc_distance(germline_set, trim_3prime_side=318)[source]

Calculates the pairwise Hamming distances between alleles in a set, optionally trimming sequences to a specified length before comparison.

Parameters:

  • germline_set (dict) -- A dictionary of allele sequences with allele names as keys.

  • trim_3prime_side (int, optional) -- The position up to which sequences should be considered. If None, the entire length is used. Defaults to 318.

Returns:

A square matrix of Hamming distances between all pairs of alleles in the set.

Return type:

ndarray

GenAIRR.utilities.asc_utilities.create_asc_germline_set(user_reference, segment='V', trim_3prime_side=318, family_threshold=75, allele_cluster_threshold=95)[source]

Creates an ASC (Allele Sequence Cluster) germline set from a user-provided reference, applying trimming and clustering thresholds.

Parameters:

  • user_reference (dict or path) -- A dictionary of allele sequences or a path to a fasta file containing alleles.

  • segment (str, optional) -- The segment type to consider (e.g., "V"). Defaults to "V".

  • trim_3prime_side (int, optional) -- The position up to which sequences should be considered for clustering. Defaults to 318.

  • family_threshold (int, optional) -- The distance threshold for classifying alleles into families. Defaults to 75.

  • allele_cluster_threshold (int, optional) -- The distance threshold for classifying alleles within families into clusters. Defaults to 95.

Returns:

A tuple containing the ASC germline set dictionary and the allele cluster table DataFrame.

Return type:

tuple

GenAIRR.utilities.asc_utilities.hamming_distance(s1, s2)[source]

Calculates the Hamming distance between two sequences, ignoring positions with 'N' and gaps represented by '.'.

Parameters:

  • s1 (str) -- The first sequence for comparison.

  • s2 (str) -- The second sequence for comparison.

Returns:

The Hamming distance between the two sequences, normalized by the number of comparable positions (excluding gaps).

Return type:

float

Parameters:

fasta (dict or path) -- A dictionary of allele sequences or a path to a fasta file containing alleles.

Tests the ASC germline set creation process using a fasta file or dictionary of alleles.

Returns:

A dictionary representing the ASC germline set.

Return type:

GenAIRR.utilities.data_config module

class GenAIRR.utilities.data_config.DataConfig[source]

Bases: object

Configuration class for storing data related to sequence generation, allele usage, trimming, and mutation rates.

This class encapsulates various dictionaries and settings used in the simulation and analysis of immunoglobulin sequences, including information about gene usage, trimming preferences, non-polymorphic (NP) region transitions, k-mer dictionaries, and allele-specific corrections.

family_use_dict

A dictionary specifying the usage frequencies of gene families.

Type:

dict

gene_use_dict

A dictionary specifying the usage frequencies of individual genes.

Type:

dict

trim_dicts

A dictionary containing information on how to trim each gene segment (V, D, J).

Type:

dict

NP_transitions

A dictionary detailing the transition probabilities for bases in NP regions.

Type:

dict

NP_first_bases

A dictionary specifying the probabilities of the first base in NP regions.

Type:

dict

NP_lengths

A dictionary defining the distribution of lengths for NP regions.

Type:

dict

mut_rate_per_seq

A dictionary specifying the mutation rate per sequence for simulating mutations.

Type:

dict

kmer_dicts

A dictionary of k-mer dictionaries used for various analyses or simulations.

Type:

dict

v_alleles, d_alleles, j_alleles

family seperated dictionary of lists for storing allele information for V, D, and J gene segments, respectively.

correction_maps

A dictionary for storing maps used for correction or adjustment of sequences or simulation parameters.

Type:

dict

asc_tables

A dictionary for storing allele sequence cluster (ASC) tables, which group alleles based on sequence similarity and other criteria.

Type:

dict

GenAIRR.utilities.data_utilities module

GenAIRR.utilities.data_utilities.create_allele_dict(fasta)[source]

Constructs a dictionary that maps immunoglobulin gene types (V, D, or J) to their corresponding alleles, based on a provided IMGT-formatted reference FASTA file.

Parameters: - fasta (file): A FASTA file that includes reference alleles for V, D, or J immunoglobulin genes,

with sequences gapped as per IMGT guidelines. The headers of these sequences should comply with IMGT formatting standards.

Returns: - allele_dict (dict): Returns a dictionary where keys are the gene types (V, D, or J) and the values

are lists containing instances of the Allele class for each allele. This dictionary includes only alleles identified as functional or as open reading frames, indicated by "F" or "ORF" in their sequence headers, formatted as {Gene: [Allele, Allele, ...]}.

GenAIRR.utilities.file_utilities module

GenAIRR.utilities.file_utilities.parse_fasta(file)[source]

Parses a FASTA format file.

Parameters:

file (file) -- A FASTA formatted file, each sequence is expected to have a header line starting with ">".

Yields:

generator -- A generator object that produces each header and sequence

GenAIRR.utilities.misc module

GenAIRR.utilities.misc.translate(seq)[source]

Translates a nucleotide sequence into a corresponding amino acid sequence using the standard genetic code.

This function translates codons (three nucleotides) into amino acids and handles incomplete codons by adding a '.' symbol. Special symbols ('.', '-', 'N') in the sequence are handled as follows: '.' is replaced with '_', '-' with 'X', and 'N' with 'X'. Stop codons are represented by '*'.

Parameters:

seq (str) -- The nucleotide sequence to be translated. The sequence should be a string of 'A', 'T', 'C', 'G', 'N', '.', or '-' characters.

Returns:

The translated amino acid sequence. Amino acids are represented by their one-letter codes. Incomplete codons, gaps, and unknown nucleotides are represented by '.', 'X', and 'X', respectively.

Return type:

str

GenAIRR.utilities.misc.weighted_choice(choices)[source]

Selects a key from a dictionary of choices based on their associated weights.

Parameters:

choices (dict) -- A dictionary where keys are the choices to select from and values are the weights of each choice.

Returns:

A randomly selected key from the dictionary, where the probability of each key is weighted according to its associated value.

Return type:

Any

GenAIRR.utilities.misc.weighted_choice_zero_break(choices)[source]

Selects a key from a dictionary of choices based on their associated weights, returning zero if the choices dictionary is empty.

Parameters:

choices (dict) -- A dictionary where keys are the choices to select from and values are the weights of each choice.

Returns:

A randomly selected key from the dictionary, where the probability of each key is weighted according to its associated value, or zero if the dictionary is empty.

Return type:

Any
